conclusion: Determine how objects A, B, C, and D will change when the light source moves to the front right.
Position of the Light Source: The light source is currently positioned behind the objects, casting shadows on the ground.
Position of the Objects: The objects are positioned on the ground, with A, B, C, and D illuminated by the light source.
Movement of the Light Source: If the light source moves to the front right, it will no longer be casting shadows on the ground.
Object A: If the light source moves to the front right, the shadow of Object A will disappear.
Object B: If the light source moves to the front right, the shadow of Object B will disappear.
Object C: If the light source moves to the front right, the shadow of Object C will disappear.
Object D: If the light source moves to the front right, the shadow of Object D will disappear.
Summary: When the light source moves to the front right, all four objects will lose their shadows on the ground.
